name: Bench Press
description: Targets the chest with secondary emphasis on the triceps and front deltoids.

name: Decline Bench Press
description: Targets the lower chest and triceps more intensely due to the decline angle.

name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
description: Isolates the chest muscles by moving dumbbells in an arc, focusing on chest width.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Works the chest, triceps, and deltoids, offering a greater range of motion than the barbell.

name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
description: Focuses on the lower part of the chest and triceps, performed on a decline bench.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
description: Limits shoulder strain and increases triceps activation by stopping at floor level.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: Works the chest and back, particularly targeting the serratus anterior and lats.

name: Floor Press
description: Emphasizes the lockout phase of the bench press, reducing shoulder engagement.

name: Incline Bench Press
description: Targets the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps, performed on an incline bench.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Focuses on the upper chest with a greater range of motion, also engaging shoulders and triceps.

name: Incline Push-Up
description: Elevates the hands to target the upper chest and reduce lower back strain.

name: Pec Deck Fly
description: Bring arms together on a pec deck to isolate the chest with constant tension.

name: Machine Chest Fly
description: Isolates chest muscles with controlled movement on a machine.

name: Machine Chest Press
description: Simulates the bench press movement in a controlled machine setup, focusing on the chest.

name: Plate-Loaded Chest Press
description: Press weight plates from a seated machine to train chest with guided motion.

name: Plate-Loaded Decline Chest Press
description: Plate-loaded decline press emphasising costal pec fibres under stable path.

name: Plate-Loaded Incline Chest Press
description: Load plates on an incline press to strengthen upper pecs under heavier loads.

name: Incline Chest Press
description: Press upward on an incline machine to bias the upper chest in a fixed track.

name: Push-Up
description: A fundamental bodyweight exercise targeting the chest, triceps, and shoulders.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
description: Provides a guided path for the bench press, focusing on the chest with less stability demand.

name: Cable Chest Fly
description: Targets the middle chest with constant tension from cable machines, perfect for isolating and sculpting the pectorals.

name: Paused Bench Press
description: Enhances chest muscle activation by incorporating a pause at the bottom of the lift.

name: Reverse Grip Bench Press
description: Switches the traditional grip to target the upper chest and shoulders more intensely, while still engaging triceps and front deltoids.

name: Bench Pin Press
description: Focuses on the top half of the bench press motion, enhancing lockout strength.

name: Decline Push-Up
description: An intense bodyweight variant that increases upper chest and shoulder involvement.

name: Diamond Push-Up
description: Targets the inner chest and triceps more effectively by positioning the hands close together in a diamond shape.

name: Low to High Cable Chest Fly
description: Targets the upper chest by moving from a low position upward, enhancing upper-chest development and definition.

name: High to Low Cable Chest Fly
description: Focuses on the lower chest by moving from a high position downward, perfect for emphasizing the lower pectorals.

name: Standing Resistance Band Chest Fly
description: Mimics the cable-fly pattern with resistance bands, allowing for flexible setup and lighter loading.

name: Kneeling Incline Push-Up
description: A reduced-load incline push-up that targets the upper chest while being beginner-friendly.

name: Kneeling Push-Up
description: A beginner-friendly push-up variation that reduces loading on the arms and chest.

name: Close-Grip Feet-Up Bench Press
description: Emphasises triceps by eliminating leg drive; chest serves as a secondary mover.

name: Feet-Up Bench Press
description: Lifting the feet increases core demand while keeping focus on chest and arms.

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
description: Targets the upper chest with extra stability from the Smith machine, reducing balance requirements.

name: Guillotine Press
description: Lower the bar to the upper chest/neck to emphasise the clavicular fibres of the pecs.

name: Decline Dumbbell Fly
description: Fly dumbbells on a decline bench to isolate the lower-pectoral fibres.

name: Costal Dip
description: Lean forward on parallel bars to shift dip emphasis to the lower chest.

name: Ring Push-Up
description: Perform push-ups on rings for greater chest activation and shoulder stability demand.

name: Archer Push-Up (Chest)
description: Shift body weight side-to-side, loading one pec heavily while the other assists.

name: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
description: Press two dumbbells together, maintaining inward squeeze to heighten inner-chest tension.

name: Standing Cable Chest Press
description: Press cables forward from a staggered stance, keeping constant pec tension through the line of pull.

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Press one dumbbell while the opposite side stabilises the torso, enhancing unilateral pec development.

name: Isometric Chest Squeeze
description: Press palms against a weight plate and squeeze to generate maximal pec contraction without movement.

name: Landmine Floor Press
description: Press a landmine bar from the floor, limiting shoulder extension and loading the mid-pecs.

name: Smith-Machine Guillotine Press
description: Use the guided bar path to safely lower to the neck, isolating the upper chest.

name: Reverse-Grip Dumbbell Press
description: Press dumbbells with a supinated grip to bias the upper-pec fibres while sparing the shoulders.

name: Wide-Grip Push-Up
description: Hands set wider than shoulder-width to place greater load on the pecs and reduce triceps involvement.

name: Medicine-Ball Push-Up
description: Place hands on a medicine ball to increase range of motion and chest activation through instability.

name: Converging Smith Bench Press
description: Smith-machine press with converging bar path that matches natural arm arc, emphasizing mid-chest while reducing shoulder stress.

name: Converging Smith Incline Bench Press
description: Incline variation targets upper-chest fibers with converging path for a stronger contraction and guided stability.

name: Converging Smith Decline Bench Press
description: Decline-angle converging Smith press that emphasizes the lower chest while providing guided bar path and added stability.

name: Arnold Press
description: A fundamental compound movement targeting the shoulders and triceps.

name: Barbell Front Raise
description: Isolates the anterior deltoids by lifting a barbell in front of you.

name: Barbell Upright Row
description: Targets the deltoids and trapezius by rowing a barbell upwards close to the body.

name: Dumbbell Upright Row
description: Targets the deltoids and trapezius by rowing dumbbells upwards close to the body.

name: Behind the Neck Press
description: Engages the side and rear deltoids by pressing a barbell from behind the neck overhead.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: Isolates side deltoids with constant tension by raising arms to the side against cable resistance.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: Strengthens the anterior deltoids by lifting dumbbells in front of you.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: Targets the lateral part of the deltoid muscle by raising dumbbells to the side.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: Works the entire deltoid region and triceps by pressing dumbbells overhead.

name: Face Pull
description: Improves posture and shoulder health by pulling a rope towards the face with a cable machine.

name: Machine Lateral Raise
description: Isolates the side deltoids using a specific machine designed for lateral raises.

name: Machine Shoulder Press
description: Targets the deltoids and triceps in a seated position with controlled motion.

name: Shoulder Press
description: A fundamental compound movement involving pressing a barbell overhead targeting the shoulders and triceps.

name: Push Press
description: Combines a moderate dip and leg drive to press overhead, working shoulders and triceps.

name: Cable Reverse Fly
description: Targets the rear deltoids and upper back by pulling cables outward in a reverse fly motion.

name: Reverse Dumbbell Fly
description: Strengthens the rear shoulders and upper back by performing a reverse fly motion with dumbbells.

name: Machine Reverse Fly
description: Isolates the rear deltoids using a machine designed for reverse fly movements.

name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: Performs an overhead press while seated, targeting the shoulder muscles and triceps.

name: Seated Shoulder Press
description: Targets the shoulders and triceps by pressing a barbell overhead from a seated position.

name: Landmine Press
description: Incorporates a landmine setup to perform a dynamic pressing movement, enhancing upper body strength and stability.

name: One Arm Landmine Press
description: Utilizes a single-arm press with a landmine, allowing for focused unilateral upper body development.

name: Viking Press
description: Employs a specialized viking press machine for a robust shoulder workout, combining strength and endurance.

name: Shoulder Pin Press
description: Targets precise strength development using a squat rack to set a specific range for overhead pressing.

name: Handstand Push-Up
description: Challenges the upper body with an inverted position, requiring no equipment and offering intense bodyweight training.

name: Front Hold
description: Challenges the anterior deltoids by statically holding weights at shoulder height in front of the body.

name: Log Press
description: A strongman staple that drives a log from shoulders to overhead, recruiting front/side delts and triceps.

name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
description: Rowing motion emphasising the rear delts while assisting the upper trapezius.

name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
description: Barbell variation targeting rear delts with substantial lower-trapezius engagement.

name: Band Pull-Apart
description: Rear-delt and postural exercise that also activates the upper trapezius.

name: Cable Rear Delt Row
description: Rows the cable toward the face/chest to ignite rear delts and upper trapezius.

name: Band External Shoulder Rotation
description: Reinforces rotator-cuff function and rear-delt strength through external rotation.

name: Band Internal Shoulder Rotation
description: Strengthens sub-scapular and front-delt fibres via internal rotation against band tension.

name: Barbell Front Hold
description: Maintains a barbell at shoulder-height to tax the anterior delts isometrically.

name: Lying Dumbbell External Shoulder Rotation
description: Side-lying variation providing constant tension to the external rotators and rear delt.

name: Lying Dumbbell Internal Shoulder Rotation
description: Strengthens the internal rotators from a side-lying position with targeted front-delt activation.

name: Cuban Press
description: Clean the dumbbells to shoulder-height, externally rotate, then press overhead, building rotator-cuff strength and delt stability.

name: Y Press
description: Press dumbbells upward and outward forming a ‘Y’, enhancing overhead stability and upper-delt recruitment.

name: Plate Raise
description: Lift a weight plate from thighs to eye-level to isolate the anterior deltoids and develop front-shoulder size.

name: Scaption Raise
description: Raise dumbbells in the scapular plane (~30° forward) to strengthen the rotator cuff and medial delts.

name: Snatch-Grip BTN Press
description: With a snatch-width grip, press the bar from behind the neck to overhead, boosting delt and upper-back strength.

name: Pike Push-Up
description: Hip-hinged push-up that mimics a bodyweight overhead press, stressing shoulders and triceps.

name: Archer Push-Up
description: One arm bends while the other stays extended, creating unilateral loading that builds shoulder stability and pushing strength.

name: KB Bottoms-Up Press
description: Press an inverted kettlebell overhead, demanding immense shoulder stability and grip control.

name: KB Halo
description: Circle a kettlebell around the head to mobilise shoulders and strengthen the entire girdle through 360° control.

name: High Pull
description: Explosively pull a barbell to chest height, developing power in traps and medial delts.

name: Bradford Press
description: Press the bar alternately in front and behind the head without lock-out, maintaining constant shoulder tension.

name: Overhead Squat
description: Squat with a snatch-width bar held overhead, integrating shoulder stability with full-body mobility and leg strength.

name: Banded Lateral Raise
description: Step on a loop band and raise arms to shoulder-height, applying ascending resistance to the lateral delts.

name: Standing Military Press
description: Press a barbell overhead from clavicle level with no leg drive, emphasising pure shoulder strength.

name: Z Press
description: Seated on the floor with legs extended, press the bar overhead, demanding core and shoulder rigidity.

name: Half-Kneeling Landmine Press
description: From a half-kneel, press a landmine bar upward on an arc, fostering unilateral shoulder power and core stability.

name: Alternating DB Front Raise
description: Lift one dumbbell to eye-level while the other lowers, maintaining tension and reducing swing for anterior-delt focus.

name: Reverse Cable Crossover
description: Cross hands on opposite cables and pull outward, isolating rear delts with continuous tension.

name: Converging Smith Shoulder Press
description: Guided overhead press where bar path converges slightly at lock-out, enhancing shoulder recruitment while sparing wrists.

name: Plate-Loaded Shoulder Press
description: Press weight overhead on a plate-loaded machine to hammer delts with extra stability.

name: Log Clean and Press
description: Clean a strongman log to shoulders then press overhead for total-body power.

name: Barbell Curl
description: A fundamental exercise for biceps growth, involving curling a barbell towards the chest.

name: Preacher Curl
description: Isolates the biceps by preventing momentum usage, performed on a preacher bench.

name: Cable Curl With Bar
description: Utilizes a cable machine for consistent resistance throughout the curl motion.

name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
description: Focuses on peak biceps contraction and minimizes momentum by sitting with elbow on the thigh.

name: Dumbbell Curl
description: A versatile biceps exercise that can be performed with various grips to target different parts.

name: EZ Bar Curl
description: A fundamental exercise for biceps growth, involving curling a barbell towards the chest.

name: Hammer Curl
description: Targets the biceps and forearms with a neutral grip, emphasizing the brachialis muscle.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
description: Increases the stretch on the biceps by performing curls on an incline bench.

name: Machine Bicep Curl
description: Allows for strict movement pattern and constant tension throughout the curl.

name: Spider Curl
description: Performed on a spider bench to prevent momentum usage, focusing on the biceps peak.

name: Strict Curl
description: Executed with strict form to enhance bicep engagement, minimizing momentum for focused intensity.

name: One Arm Cable Bicep Curl
description: Provides continuous tension using a cable system, ensuring a full range of motion for precise bicep conditioning.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl
description: Involves a preacher bench to support the arm and isolate the bicep curl, enhancing focus and form.

name: Incline Hammer Curl
description: Performed on an incline bench to increase the range of motion and intensify the bicep workout.

name: Zottman Curl
description: Combines traditional and reverse curls to challenge the biceps and forearms, enhancing grip and forearm strength.

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
description: Allows for a stable seated position to focus on controlled bicep curls, minimizing body movement for better isolation.

name: Cheat Curl
description: Incorporates slight body momentum to enable lifting heavier weights, intensifying bicep engagement.

name: Cable Hammer Curl
description: Utilizes a cable setup to maintain resistance, focusing on the biceps and enhancing forearm involvement.

name: Overhead Cable Curl
description: Engages the biceps through a unique overhead cable setup, increasing the difficulty and effectiveness of the curl.

name: Incline Cable Curl
description: Performed on an incline using a cable to ensure continuous tension throughout the motion, targeting the biceps efficiently.

name: Lying Cable Curl
description: Involves lying down to perform curls with a cable, maximizing the resistance curve and minimizing momentum.

name: Cable Curl With Rope
description: Adds variation to standard curls with a rope attachment, emphasising peak contraction.

name: Concentration Curl
description: Strict seated curl with elbow braced on the thigh to maximise biceps peak contraction.

name: Drag Curl
description: Curls the barbell up the torso to emphasise the long head while minimising shoulder flexion.

name: EZ-Bar Reverse Curl
description: Uses a pronated grip on an EZ bar to target the brachialis and forearm extensors alongside the biceps.

name: EZ-Bar Preacher Curl
description: Isolates the biceps by preventing body sway while curling an EZ bar on a preacher bench.

name: 21s Curl
description: Seven lower-half, seven upper-half and seven full-range barbell curls completed consecutively for metabolic stress.

name: Band Biceps Curl
description: Performs curls against elastic resistance, offering ascending tension for the biceps through each rep.

name: Reverse-Grip Preacher Curl
description: Uses a pronated grip on a preacher bench to bias the brachialis and forearm extensors.

name: Bayesian Curl
description: Cable curl performed with the arm extended behind the torso to maximise biceps stretch and tension.

name: Cable Concentration Curl
description: Kneeling close to the weight stack, curls a single cable handle for peak contraction and strict form.

name: Standing Cable Curl
description: Straight-bar cable curls deliver constant tension across the full range for balanced biceps loading.

name: Barbell Spider Curl
description: Prone on an incline bench, curls a barbell straight down to eliminate cheating and smash the biceps peak.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: Focuses on triceps strength with secondary chest engagement.

name: Dips
description: Primarily targets the lower chest and triceps when leaned forward.

name: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension
description: Also known as skull crushers, this exercise targets the triceps by extending the arms from a lying position.

name: Bench Dips
description: Uses body weight to work the triceps, with hands placed on a bench behind the body.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up
description: Emphasizes triceps engagement by performing push-ups with a narrow hand position.

name: Lying Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Targets the triceps by extending dumbbells overhead while lying on a bench.

name: Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Engages the triceps by extending a dumbbell overhead with both hands.

name: Cable Overhead Triceps Extension
description: Utilizes a cable machine to extend the arms overhead, isolating the triceps.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Kickback
description: Involves a hinged motion at the elbow to extend the dumbbell backward, maximizing tricep engagement in a bent-over position.

name: Standing Barbell Triceps Extension
description: Involves lifting a barbell overhead and extending the arms to work the triceps in a standing position.

name: Machine Seated Dip
description: Mimics the dipping motion on a specialized machine, focusing on tricep activation without the need for body weight support.

name: Machine Tricep Extension
description: Facilitates tricep extensions on a machine, allowing for precise control and isolation of the tricep muscles.

name: Seated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description: Performed seated with a dumbbell extended overhead, this exercise focuses on controlled tricep engagement.

name: Tricep Pushdown With Bar
description: Utilizes a bar attachment on a cable machine for a downward tricep pushdown, emphasizing consistent resistance throughout the motion.

name: Reverse Grip Tricep Pushdown
description: Involves a reverse grip on a cable machine to vary the tricep pushdown, targeting different aspects of the triceps.

name: Tricep Rope Pushdown
description: Features a rope attachment for tricep pushdowns on a cable machine, enhancing the peak contraction phase of the exercise.

name: JM Press
description: Blends elements of a close-grip bench press and a tricep extension to create a unique and effective tricep exercise.

name: Tate Press
description: Executed by lifting dumbbells from a supine position on a flat bench, directly engaging the triceps with each press.

name: Ring Dips
description: Body-weight dip on rings that heavily loads all three triceps heads.

name: Skull Crusher (EZ-Bar)
description: Lying on a flat bench, lower an EZ-bar toward the forehead then extend the elbows, isolating all three triceps heads.

name: Overhead Rope Triceps Extension
description: With a rope attached high, extend the elbows overhead to emphasise the long head through a deep stretch.

name: One-Arm Cable Triceps Extension
description: Standing side-on to the stack, extend one arm downward for unilateral triceps isolation and balanced development.

name: Single-Arm DB Skull Crusher
description: Performed one arm at a time on a flat bench, enabling strict elbow tracking and equal triceps stimulus.

name: Cable Triceps Kickback
description: Hinge at the hips and extend the elbow against cable tension, keeping the upper arm fixed for maximal lateral-head engagement.

name: Bent-Over DB Triceps Extension
description: In a bent-over stance, extend the elbow to drive dumbbell rearward, isolating the triceps with free-weight control.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up (Knees)
description: With knees on the floor and hands narrow, push up to emphasise triceps while reducing overall load.

name: Diamond Cutter Push-Up
description: Hands form a diamond beneath the chest, lowering until sternum touches then explosively pressing back for intense arm engagement.

name: Body-Weight Triceps Extension (Rack)
description: Using a bar in a rack, lean forward and flex the elbows, then extend to press the body back, isolating the triceps with body weight.

name: Tate Push-Up
description: Hands turned inward, lower elbows outward then press back, mimicking the dumbbell Tate press for body-weight triceps overload.

name: Bench Dip (Feet Elevated)
description: Hands on one bench, heels on another, lower hips below elbows then press up for greater triceps loading than standard dips.

name: Weighted Dip
description: Using a dip belt for extra load, lower to 90° elbows then press up, intensifying triceps and lower-chest activation.

name: Bodyweight Squat
description: A foundational exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes using body weight.

name: Barbell Hack Squat
description: Performs a squat holding a barbell behind the legs, emphasizing the quadriceps and glutes.

name: Machine Hack Squat
description: Utilizes a machine to perform a squat motion, focusing on the quadriceps with less lower back strain.

name: Pause Squat
description: Increases time under tension by pausing at the bottom of the squat, focusing on leg strength.

name: Smith Machine Squat
description: Performs squats within the guided path of a Smith machine, focusing on leg muscles.

name: Back Squat
description: A fundamental lower-body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

name: Zercher Squat
description: This squat variation involves cradling the barbell in the crook of the elbows, enhancing engagement of the quads and upper back while improving core stability.

name: Vertical Leg Press
description: Utilizes a vertical press machine to intensify focus on the quads, glutes, and hamstrings, maximizing resistance while lying back.

name: Horizontal Leg Press
description: Features a horizontal pressing motion to engage the quads, glutes, and hamstrings, offering a comfortable seated position for effective load handling.

name: Pistol Squat
description: Challenges strength and balance through a single-legged squat to full depth, effectively targeting the quads, hamstrings, and glutes with bodyweight alone.

name: Box Squat
description: Enhances squat depth and form by squatting to a box, focusing on the quadriceps and glutes.

name: Dumbbell Squat
description: A squat variation using dumbbells to add resistance, targeting the quadriceps and glutes.

name: Leg Press
description: Targets the lower body by pressing weight away using the legs, focusing on the quadriceps.

name: Reverse Lunge
description: Involves stepping backward into a lunge to emphasize lower body strength and stability, engaging quads and glutes without additional equipment.

name: Side Lunge
description: Engages the quadriceps, glutes, and inner thigh muscles by stepping out to the side.

name: Lunge
description: A versatile exercise targeting the quads and glutes, performed without any equipment.

name: Barbell Lunge
description: A dynamic exercise that targets the legs and glutes, performed with a barbell for added resistance.

name: Barbell Walking Lunge
description: Involves lunging forward in a walking motion, greatly engaging the quadriceps and glutes.

name: Dumbbell Lunge
description: Engages the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes, performed with dumbbells for resistance.

name: Chair Squat
description: Beginner-friendly squat that builds control by sitting back to a chair.

name: Step Up
description: Strengthens legs and glutes by stepping onto an elevated surface.

name: Belt Squat
description: Focuses on the lower body, particularly the quadriceps, without loading the spine.

name: Safety Bar Squat
description: A squat variation using a safety bar, allowing for a more comfortable position on the shoulders.

name: Front Squat
description: Emphasizes the quadriceps and upper back by holding a barbell in front of the body.

name: Goblet Squat
description: A squat variation holding a dumbbell or kettlebell in front of the chest, targeting the quads.

name: Landmine Squat
description: A squat variation using a landmine setup to add anterior load, focusing on quadriceps.

name: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Elevates one leg on a bench for a split squat, increasing load with a barbell to significantly boost quad and glute strength.

name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Incorporates dumbbells to enhance the split squat, providing a versatile and intense workout for the quads, glutes, and hamstrings.

name: Leg Extension
description: Isolates the quadriceps by extending the legs against resistance in a seated position.

name: Cable Leg Extension
description: Performed with a cable machine, this exercise isolates the quadriceps by extending the legs against resistance from a seated position, ensuring targeted muscle activation.

name: Machine Hip Adduction
description: Targets the inner thigh muscles by bringing the legs together against resistance.

name: Trap Bar Deadlift
description: Utilizes a trap bar to perform deadlifts, reducing strain on the lower back and engaging the legs.

name: Pendulum Squat
description: Squat along a pendulum arc to smash quads with joint-friendly mechanics.

name: Sissy Squat
description: Keep torso upright and rise onto toes while bending knees deeply to isolate the quadriceps through extreme knee flexion.

name: Cossack Squat
description: Shift weight laterally into a deep single-leg squat while straightening the opposite leg, developing strength and mobility across hips and quads.

name: Curtsy Lunge
description: Step one leg diagonally behind the other into a deep lunge, emphasising glute medius activation and inner-thigh stability.

name: Spanish Squat
description: Anchor a band behind knees, sit back while maintaining vertical shins to heavily bias quadriceps through terminal knee extension.

name: Jefferson Squat
description: Straddle a barbell between the legs, grip with mixed hands, and squat while maintaining a neutral spine to train lower-body strength with rotational demand.

name: Sissy Hack Squat
description: Position the body far forward on a hack-squat sled and descend with hips extended to replicate a loaded sissy squat for maximal quad tension.

name: Goblet Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Hold a dumbbell at the chest while performing a split squat with rear foot elevated to intensify quad and glute recruitment.

name: Cyclist Squat
description: Squat with narrow stance and raised heels to maintain an upright torso and place greater load on the quadriceps.

name: Trap-Bar Jump Squat
description: Explosively jump from a squat while holding a trap bar, enhancing power through quads, glutes and calves.

name: Split-Squat Jump
description: Drive explosively out of a split-squat stance to leave the ground, building unilateral power and lower-body strength.

name: V-Squat
description: Perform squats on a V-squat machine for quad focus with fixed back support.

name: Jefferson Squat
description: Straddle a barbell between the legs, grip with mixed hands, and squat while maintaining a neutral spine to train lower-body strength with rotational demand.

name: Standing Leg Curl
description: Executed on a machine that targets the hamstrings through dynamic leg curling, focusing on muscle contraction while standing.

name: Seated Leg Curl
description: Targets the hamstrings by curling the legs towards the body in a seated position.

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: Strengthens the posterior chain, including the hamstrings and glutes, by hinging at the hips.

name: Lying Leg Curl
description: Isolates the hamstrings by curling the legs towards the body in a prone position.

name: Good Morning
description: Strengthens the lower back and hamstrings by hinging at the waist with a barbell on the shoulders.

name: Nordic Ham Curl
description: Anchor the heels and lower under control, then contract the hamstrings to return upright.

name: Glute-Ham Raise
description: Extend and flex at the knee and hip on a GHD to train hamstrings and glutes through a long range.

name: Reverse Hyperextension
description: Lift the legs behind the body on a reverse-hyper machine to strengthen hamstrings and glutes while unloading the spine.

name: Bodyweight Reverse Hyperextension
description: Lie prone on a glute-ham raise bench, hinging at the hips to lift both legs behind the body; trains hamstrings and glutes while keeping spinal load minimal.

name: Slider Leg Curl
description: From a bridge position, extend and curl the legs on floor sliders to isolate the hamstrings.

name: Swiss-Ball Leg Curl
description: Bridge on shoulders and roll a Swiss ball toward the hips by flexing the knees.

name: Stability-Ball Hamstring Curl
description: Similar to the Swiss-ball curl, maintaining bridge while bending the knees to draw the ball inward.

name: Reverse Nordic Curl
description: Lean back from tall-kneeling and return upright, lengthening and loading the anterior thigh while engaging hamstrings as stabilisers.

name: Single-Leg Hip Thrust
description: Elevate the back on a bench and drive one leg upward, extending the hip to target hamstrings and glutes unilaterally.

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: Targets the soleus muscle of the calves by lifting weight from a seated position.

name: Standing Calf Raise
description: Strengthens the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles by raising the heels off the ground.

name: Barbell Calf Raise
description: Strengthens the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles by raising the heels off the ground.

name: Dumbbell Calf Raise
description: Strengthens the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles by raising the heels off the ground.

name: Bodyweight Calf Raise
description: A simple yet effective movement using body weight to elevate the heels, enhancing calf strength and flexibility. Can be performed anywhere, requiring minimal space.

name: Leg Press Calf Raise
description: Utilizes a leg press machine to isolate and strengthen the calves, providing resistance through the leg press motion specifically targeting the heel raise.

name: Single Leg Seated Calf Raise
description: Focuses on the soleus muscle with controlled resistance in a seated position, enhancing lower calf development and unilateral strength by working one leg at a time.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: Bend forward at the hips with straight knees and rise onto the balls of the feet to emphasise the gastrocnemius through a full stretch.

name: Calf Press
description: Extend the ankles against the sled of a leg-press machine to train the calves under heavy load while hips and knees stay fixed.

name: Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise
description: Hold dumbbells at the sides and elevate the heels to strengthen the calves with added resistance.

name: Tibialis Raise
description: Lean back against a wall and lift the toes toward the shins to isolate and strengthen the tibialis anterior.

name: Toe Walk
description: Walk forward on the balls of the feet to build endurance in both heads of the calf muscles.

name: Plate-Loaded Standing Calf Raise
description: Raise heels on a plate-loaded machine to grow gastrocnemius and soleus.

name: Cable Pull Through
description: Strengthens the glutes and hamstrings by pulling a cable through the legs to hip extension.

name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
description: Focuses on the glutes and hamstrings by bending at the hips with dumbbells in hand.

name: Single Leg Romanian Deadlift
description: Challenges balance and targets the glutes and hamstrings by lifting one leg and bending at the hip with weight.

name: Glute Bridge
description: Targets the glutes by lifting the hips towards the ceiling while lying on the back.

name: Machine Hip Abduction
description: Isolates the outer glutes by pushing out against the resistance of a machine.

name: Machine Glute Kickback
description: Extend hip against pad to isolate and strengthen the gluteus maximus.

name: Hip Thrust
description: Maximizes glute engagement by thrusting the hips upwards with weight across the pelvis.

name: Cable Glute Kickbacks
description: Isolates the glutes by performing kickbacks against the pull of a cable machine.

name: Frog Pump
description: With soles together and knees out, drive hips upward to contract the glutes through hip extension.

name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
description: Elevate one leg and drive the opposite hip upward to isolate glutes and hamstrings on a single side.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
description: Rest upper back on a bench and drive hips upward against a barbell to maximally load the glutes.

name: Banded Hip Thrust
description: Loop a band over the hips and thrust upward to emphasise glute contraction with accommodating resistance.

name: Hip Airplane
description: Balance on one leg, hinge forward, then rotate the torso side-to-side to develop hip stability and glute strength.

name: Copenhagen Plank
description: Support the upper leg on an elevated surface and hold a side plank, intensifying glute medius and adductor engagement.

name: Weighted Back Extension
description: Strengthens the lower back muscles by extending the spine against gravity.

name: Back Extension
description: Strengthens the lower back muscles by extending the spine against gravity.

name: Machine Back Extension
description: Strengthens the lower back muscles by extending the spine against gravity.

name: Deadlift
description: A fundamental strength exercise that targets the lower back, hamstrings, and quads.

name: Deficit Deadlift
description: Increases the range of motion of the standard deadlift, enhancing leg and lower back activation.

name: Dumbbell Deadlift
description: A variation of the deadlift using dumbbells to target the lower back, hamstrings, and quads.

name: Pause Deadlift
description: Enhances tension in the lower back by pausing midway during the deadlift.

name: Rack Pull
description: A deadlift variation that focuses on the top half of the movement, emphasizing lower back strength.

name: Stiff-Legged Deadlift
description: Targets the hamstrings and lower back by keeping the legs straight while bending at the waist.

name: Sumo Deadlift
description: A deadlift variation with a wide stance, targeting the lower back, glutes, and inner thighs.

name: Snatch Grip Deadlift
description: Wide-grip deadlift that increases range of motion and back demand.

name: Jefferson Curl
description: Slow spinal flexion with weight to build back strength and mobility.

name: Kettlebell Swing
description: Ballistic hip-hinge movement that builds posterior-chain power.

name: Meadows Row
description: Single-arm landmine row performed across the body to emphasise the outer lats and mid-back.

name: Seal Row
description: Rowing a barbell while lying face-down on a bench eliminates body momentum to isolate the lats and mid-back.

name: Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
description: Rows performed prone on an incline bench with dumbbells to increase lat engagement while minimising lower-back strain.

name: Kroc Row
description: High-rep, heavy single-arm dumbbell rows that build back thickness and grip strength.

name: Iso-Lateral High Row (Machine)
description: Plate-loaded machine row that pulls from a high path, emphasising upper-lat and rear-delt fibres.

name: Iso-Lateral Low Row (Machine)
description: Iso-lateral plate-loaded machine that rows from a low angle to hit the mid-lats and rhomboids.

name: Landmine Row
description: Rows a landmine-loaded bar using a neutral handle for balanced development of the lats and mid-back.

name: I-Y-T Raise (on Bench)
description: Sequence of three raises (I, Y, T) on an incline bench to activate the lower traps and rear delts for scapular stability.

name: Prone Y Raise
description: Raises light dumbbells into a Y-shape while prone to strengthen the lower traps and rear delts.

name: Prone Cobra
description: Isometric hold in a prone, arms-back position that reinforces spinal extensors and postural muscles.

name: Superman
description: Simultaneously lifts arms and legs while prone to build lower-back endurance and glute strength.

name: Standing T-Bar Row
description: Rows a plate-loaded T-bar while standing over the platform to build overall back thickness.

name: Renegade Row
description: Combines a plank with alternating dumbbell rows to train the lats, arms and anti-rotational core strength.

name: Single-Arm Cable Row
description: Uses a single cable handle to row with one arm, promoting balanced lat development and core stability.

name: Machine Pullover
description: Pull pads from overhead to hips to strengthen lats and serratus under constant tension.

name: Barbell Row
description: Targets the upper and middle back muscles, including the lats and rhomboids, by rowing a barbell.

name: Chin-Up
description: Under-hand pull to bring the chin above the bar, emphasising biceps while still hitting the lats hard.

name: Assisted Chin-Up
description: Uses a counter-weight or band to let beginners practise full-range chin-ups with manageable load.

name: Weighted Chin-Up
description: Performs a chin-up while wearing a dip belt or loading pin to progress strength beyond body-weight.

name: Pull-Up
description: Classic over-hand pull to the bar, heavily recruiting the lats while the biceps assist.

name: Assisted Pull-Up
description: Machine or band support offsets a percentage of body-weight, letting lifters focus on form and full range.

name: Weighted Pull-Up
description: An advanced progression adding external load via dip belt, vest or plates for greater strength stimulus.

name: Neutral Grip Pull-Up
description: Palms-facing grip reduces shoulder stress and balances lat–biceps contribution.

name: Assisted Neutral Grip Pull-Up
description: Neutral-grip version performed on an assisted machine or with bands, ideal for beginners or rehab.

name: Weighted Neutral Grip Pull-Up
description: Adds external resistance to the joint-friendly neutral pull-up for continued strength gains.

name: Muscle-Up
description: Explosive pull-up transitioning into a dip above the bar, demanding powerful upper-body coordination.

name: Weighted Muscle-Up
description: Muscle-up executed with added load from a dip belt—reserved for athletes with elite pulling & pressing strength.

name: Seated Cable Row
description: Engages the middle back muscles and secondary arm muscles by rowing a cable towards the torso.

name: Seated Machine Row
description: Targets the middle back muscles with a stable and controlled rowing motion.

name: Dumbbell Row
description: Engages the upper and middle back muscles by rowing a dumbbell with one arm.

name: Inverted Row
description: Strengthens the back and biceps by rowing the body upwards towards a bar.

name: T-Bar Row
description: Targets the back muscles by rowing a T-bar loaded with weights towards the torso.

name: Pendlay Row
description: A strict rowing motion from the floor, targeting the upper and middle back with minimal momentum.

name: Lat Pulldown
description: Targets the latissimus dorsi and biceps by pulling a bar down in front of the body.

name: Reverse Grip Lat Pulldown
description: Engages the lats and biceps with a reverse grip, altering the pull angle for varied muscle activation.

name: One-Arm Lat Pulldown
description: Focuses on unilateral lat development by pulling down a cable with one arm.

name: Straight Arm Lat Pulldown
description: Isolates the lats by pulling a bar down with straight arms, focusing on lat width.

name: Wrist Roller
description: Roll a weight-loaded cord up and down to build balanced strength in both flexors and extensors.

name: Plate Flip
description: Toss and catch a weight plate in mid-air, flipping it to develop explosive wrist-extensor strength and coordination.

name: Rice-Bucket Wrist Twist
description: Twist the hands through deep rice to strengthen flexion, extension, and rotational grip capacity with high volume.

name: Farmer Walk Pinch-Grip
description: Walk for distance while pinching smooth blocks or plates together to tax thumbs and forearm flexors intensely.

name: Thick-Bar Hold
description: Support a heavily loaded thick bar for time to overwhelm gripping surfaces and build crush strength.

name: Smith Machine Shrug
description: Targets the upper back, specifically the trapezius muscles, by lifting and lowering the shoulders using the guided stability of a Smith machine.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: Targets the traps by elevating the shoulders while holding dumbbells.

name: Barbell Shrug
description: Focuses on the trapezius muscles by shrugging the shoulders while holding a barbell.

name: Cable Shrug
description: Isolates the upper traps using constant cable resistance.

name: Trap Bar Shrug
description: Neutral-grip shrug with trap bar to overload the upper traps.

name: Farmer's Carry
description: Walk for distance or time while holding heavy farmer handles to build grip and upper-back strength.

name: Machine Shoulder Shrug
description: Elevate shoulders on a shrug machine to bulk the upper traps safely.

name: Ab Wheel Roll-Out
description: Strengthens the entire abdominal region through extension and contraction with an ab wheel.

name: Crunch
description: A fundamental exercise focusing on the upper abdominals with potential engagement of the lower abs.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Strengthens the lower abdominals by raising the legs to parallel while hanging from a bar.

name: Elbow-Supported Leg Raise
description: Lower-ab and hip-flexor raise performed with the forearms braced on a captains-chair / dip-station so grip fatigue is removed.

name: Hanging Knee Raise
description: Focuses on the lower abs by raising the knees towards the chest in a hanging position.

name: Elbow-Supported Knee Raise
description: Lower-ab knee tuck performed with the forearms braced on a captains-chair / dip-station so grip fatigue is eliminated.

name: Cable Wood Chop
description: Engages the obliques and abs by moving the cable horizontally across the body.

name: Lying Leg Raise
description: Isolates the lower abdominals by raising the legs while lying on the back.

name: Machine Seated Crunch
description: Allows for targeted abdominal exercises with adjustable resistance.

name: Mountain Climbers
description: A dynamic exercise that combines cardio with core strengthening.

name: Russian Twist
description: Targets the side abdominal muscles by performing a crunch with a twist.

name: Scissor Kicks
description: Strengthens the lower abs through alternating leg movements while lying on the back.

name: Sit-Up
description: A classic abdominal exercise targeting the entire abs region through a full range of motion.

name: Standing Cable Crunch
description: Engages the core by crunching downward using cable resistance while standing, providing an intense focus on the upper abdominals.

name: High Pulley Crunch
description: Executed by pulling down on a cable from a standing position, this crunch intensely works the upper abs with full core engagement.

name: Decline Crunch
description: Performed on a decline bench, this exercise maximizes abdominal muscle contraction through an increased range of motion, targeting both upper and lower abs.

name: Toes to Bar
description: Challenges the core by hanging from a bar and lifting toes to meet the bar, engaging primarily the lower abs and improving grip and upper body strength.

name: Flutter Kicks
description: Involves lying flat and alternating leg movements to strengthen the lower abs and increase core endurance.

name: Decline Sit-Up
description: Utilizes a decline bench to increase the intensity of the sit-up, engaging the full abdominal region for comprehensive core strength.

name: Cable Crunch
description: Involves kneeling and crunching down against a cable for concentrated abdominal resistance, targeting the entire core for optimal strength and conditioning.

name: Side Crunch
description: Focuses on oblique muscles by performing lateral crunches, enhancing side core strength and flexibility, suitable for floor execution.

name: Side Plank
description: Core-stability drill holding a straight-body side position.

name: Kneeling Plank
description: Beginner plank variation on knees focusing on core activation.

name: Kneeling Side Plank
description: Side plank regression with knees down for easier balance.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: A gymnast staple that builds full-body tension by holding a curved “hollow” position, firing the entire core.

name: V-Up
description: Snaps the torso and legs together into a sharp “V”, hammering both upper and lower abs.

name: Dragon Flag
description: Advanced core move popularized by Bruce Lee—lower and raise a straight body while shoulders stay pinned.

name: Reverse Crunch
description: Rolls the pelvis toward the ribs, lifting the hips to torch the lower abs.

name: Bicycle Crunch
description: Alternating elbow-to-knee action that lights up the obliques and entire mid-section.

name: Plank
description: Classic anti-extension hold that trains global core stability.

name: RKC Plank
description: High-tension plank variation—pull elbows to toes and squeeze glutes for a brutal 10-second hold.

name: TRX Pike
description: Feet-in-straps pike that drags hips sky-high, crushing the lower abs and hip-flexors.

name: TRX Body Saw
description: Plank on straps—rocking the body forward and back to super-charge core stability.

name: Stability Ball Rollout
description: Kneeling rollout on a Swiss ball—ab-wheel intensity with a friendlier learning curve.

name: Stability Ball Pike
description: Feet on ball, hips snap up into a pike—pure lower-ab domination with balance demand.

name: Jackknife Sit-Up
description: Both arms and legs rise to meet—creates a powerful contraction across the entire six-pack.

name: Medicine Ball Slam
description: Explosive overhead slam that channels power through the core, shoulders, and lats.

name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
description: Seated torso rotation with a med-ball—oblique-centric with constant load.

name: Dead Bug
description: Alternating arm/leg extension while maintaining a braced core—teaches lumbo-pelvic control.

name: Bird Dog
description: Core-stability drill that pairs opposite arm and leg extension to train anti-rotation and balance.

name: Pallof Press
description: Press-out hold that resists cable pull, training the core to fight rotation.

name: Landmine Anti-Rotation
description: Steer the bar in an arc from hip to hip—an anti-rotation crusher that also hits shoulders.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl
description: Strengthens the forearm flexors by curling a barbell towards the forearm.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
description: Targets the wrist flexors with individual dumbbells for balanced muscle development.

name: Reverse Wrist Curl
description: Focuses on strengthening the forearm extensors by curling the wrists upwards.

name: Barbell Reverse Curl
description: Engages the forearm extensors by reversing the grip on a barbell, enhancing wrist stability and upper arm strength.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
description: Utilizes dumbbells with a reverse grip to focus on the forearm extensors, promoting balanced muscle growth and enhanced forearm strength.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
description: Performed seated with a dumbbell in each hand, this exercise isolates the wrist flexors, improving grip strength and wrist mobility.

name: Pinch-Block Static Hold
description: Grip pinch blocks and hold for time to develop crushing thumb strength.

name: Farmers Walk
description: Builds crushing grip and whole-body stability by carrying heavy implements for distance or time.

name: One-Handed Bar Hang
description: Enhances unilateral grip strength by suspending body-weight from a bar with one hand.

name: Plate Pinch
description: Develops thumb and finger strength by holding weight plates together for time.

name: Plate Wrist Curl
description: Isolates the forearm flexors via wrist flexion with a single plate.

name: Towel Pull-Up
description: Increases grip challenge by performing pull-ups while gripping towels draped over a bar.

name: Split Jerk
description: Explosively drives a bar overhead while the feet split, building shoulder and leg power.

name: Power Clean
description: Accelerates a barbell from floor to shoulders, training total-body power and back strength.

name: Power Snatch
description: Propels a barbell overhead in one motion from the floor, emphasizing speed and upper-back activation.

name: Snatch
description: Classic Olympic lift bringing the bar from floor to overhead in one fluid squat-catch.

name: Clean
description: Lifts the bar from floor to shoulders with a full squat catch, training posterior chain and quads.

name: Clean and Jerk
description: Combines a clean with an explosive jerk overhead, taxing the entire body.

name: Clean and Press
description: Finishes the clean with a strict overhead press instead of a jerk for added shoulder demand.

name: Hang Clean
description: Performed from the hang position to sharpen the second pull and posterior-chain explosiveness.

name: Hang Power Clean
description: Hang-start clean caught above parallel to emphasize quick turnover and power.

name: Hang Power Snatch
description: Power snatch from hang height, reinforcing explosive hip extension.

name: Hang Snatch
description: Full-squat snatch executed from the hang to develop pulling power and speed under the bar.

name: Power Jerk
description: Drives the bar overhead with a shallow dip-catch, stressing shoulder power.

name: Squat Jerk
description: Catches the jerk in a full squat, demanding elite mobility and stability.

name: Cambered Bar Squat
description: Squat with a cambered bar to reduce shoulder stress while emphasizing quads and glutes.

name: Chair Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Rear-foot-elevated split squat using a sturdy chair to build unilateral leg strength.

name: Compact Leg Press
description: Seated leg press machine with a compact sled to train the lower body safely.

name: Farmer's Walk
description: Carry heavy farmer’s handles for distance or time to tax grip, traps and legs.

name: Plate-Loaded Incline Chest Press
description: Plate-loaded variant of the incline chest press for heavy progressive overload.

name: Incline Row
description: Chest-supported incline row machine targeting the upper-back musculature.

name: Pendulum Squat
description: Lever-based pendulum squat providing quad dominance with reduced spinal load.

name: Pinch Block Hold
description: Grip blocks between the fingers and thumb to build pinch-grip strength.

name: Machine Preacher Curl
description: Curl forearms on a preacher pad to isolate the biceps with machine resistance.

name: Prowler Sled Push
description: Drive a loaded sled over turf for full-body power and conditioning.

name: Rotary Torso Twist
description: Seated torso rotation machine for obliques and core stability.

name: Parallel Bar Dip
description: Vertical pressing with bodyweight to develop triceps and lower chest.

name: Yoke Carry
description: Carry a loaded yoke frame for distance to build full-body strength and stability.

name: Towel Row
description: Row bodyweight using towels over a bar to challenge grip and lats.
